properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 2:37AM MST until February 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm system will bring snow to northeast Wyoming and
western South Dakota tonight through Monday. Snow amounts of greater
than 6 inches are expected across portions of northeast Wyoming
plains, the Bearlodge Mountains, and the northern to central Black
Hills. Lesser amounts are expected along the northern and eastern
foothills. Snow will begin this evening and continue through
Monday morning. Snow will gradually decrease through Monday
afternoon, but could linger across portions of the northeast
Wyoming plains through Monday afternoon and evening.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to
10 inches.

* WHERE...Northern Campbell County and the Weston County Plains.

* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to midnight MST Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MST MONDAY NIGHT
